title: Modify Array Data with Indexes
content: Unlike strings, the entries of arrays are mutable and can be changed freely, even if the array has been declared with const.
There shouldn't be any spaces between the array name and the square brackets, like array[0]. Although JavaScript is able to process this correctly, this may confuse other programmers reading code.

exercises.instruction: Modify the data stored at index 0 of myArray to a value of 45.

hint: You should be using correct index to modify the value in myArray
